result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan Marie Quade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misd. Theft, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Megan Marie Quade in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Megan Marie Quade in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:38 PM. State - here for SEHR. Joy has received the revocation paperwork and does not see any ommissions or mistakes. State - read the revocation summary - recommends time served sentence. Joy - recommends time served sentence as well (185 days). SW Jameson makes statement in regards to inpatient treatment for the defendant once she is sentenced. State make brief statement. Joy makes statement. Quade makes statement, remorseful. Court imposes 185 days on each count, concurrent to each other. Turn all un-paid fines and fees into a civil judgment. Grandfather, Bob Conn, makes statement.

Defendant Megan Marie Quade in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:05 AM. State - resolved. Finlan - provides court with plea questionnaire - plead g/nc to count #1 as amended to misd theft contrary to 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a), plead g/nc to count #2 as alleged, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditons of: restitution to be determined ($800.00 approximately), court costs on each count. State agrees, would like to add no consumption of alcohol and AODA for stated reasons - have complied with victim notification requirements - restitution would be $800.00 plus VW surcharge. Finlan agrees with that amount. Quade agrees. Court amends count #1 to misd theft contrary to 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a) - reads new penalties and charge. Quade pleads NC to count #1 as amended and NC to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - offers a suggestion to add condition of a community based self-help group. Discussion on whether there is a joint recommendation. Finlan confers with client. Recess at 10:17 AM to talk to client further about State's new suggestion. Recalled at 10:24 AM with same appearances. Finaln - not going to declare a breach of the agreement and client would be willing to partake in a community bases group. State withdraws that statement. Finlan makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - credit for 85 days if revoked. State stipulates to the credit. Quade withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of:  costs on each count, restitution of $800.00 plus $80 VW surcharge totalling $880.00 - take bond posted - remainder due thru probation, right to appeal, adjourned.
from attorney Finlan requesting adjournment of plea/sentencing for stated reasons in letter.

Defendant Megan Marie Quade in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:38 NOt resolved - set for JT. Court continues bond and sets for JT. Motions in limine will be heard at 8:30 AM on first day of trial and if MIL requires evidentiary hearing, schedule 2 weeks prior to trial.  Jury trial scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Megan Marie Quade in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan appearing telephonically.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:07 PM. Court - continues bond - fills defense counsel in on case history - Court did previously receive a speedy trial demand - Court advises DA to send discovery to Finlan or to get it from Roley - DA states they will get discovery to Finlan - waives right to speedy trial be defendand but talk to Finlan prior to accepting the waiver, continues bond.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on January 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on January 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Called at 10:54 AM. Megan Quade appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Attorney Roley was holding prior to calling the case but now cannot get a hold of him. Court - here for a motion to adjourn filed by Roley. Court puts off record conversations on the record in regards to the defendant hiring a different attorney. Court has talked to SPD and informed them that he will be releasing Mr. Roley from the case and another public defender needs to be appointed. Court - there is a speedy trial demand. Quade withdraws her request for speedy trial. Court discharges Attorney Roley from the case, Court considers the request for speedy trial demand to be withdrawn, continues bond, will cancel the JT that is scheduled for 1/12/15 and defendant/new counsel to contact the court when appointed so that the case can be put back on the calendar as a JT. State to prepare order stating that Roley has been discharged and SPD is to appoint another attrney for the defendant. Court sets for STC on 1/21/15 at 10:00 AM. Adjourned at 11:05 AM.

Called at 9:55 AM. Megan Quade appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. State - Roley filed motion to withdraw as counsel, not sure why he is not here. Motion denied at this point for stated reasons, Quade working on another attorney. Jury trial is still set for 1/12/15, bond continued. Court will consider another motion to adjourn but defendant to contact Roley and SPD. Tom Roley now appears telephonically at 10:01 AM - thought the hearing was this afternoon. Roley - discussion on motion for examination. Quade responds - denies the need for examination. State responds - does not see any indication for need of examination for stated reasons. Court does brief collaquey regarding need for examination. Court denies motion for examination, finds the defendant is competent to proceed. Roley responds - objects that Court can find if the defendant is competent to proceed. Court responds - still denies motion for examination. Court continues bond, matter is still set for JT on 1/12/15.
No contact with Mike or Mary Kegley or any property belonging to the Kegley's.

Called 3:02 p.m. FTR recorded. Charles Simono appears for the State. Attorney Tom Roley appears telephonically and Megan Quade appears via video from the FC jail. Roley asking for high signature bond for stated reasons. Quade - probation hold was lifited last Thursday and once released has to report to P&P. Simono - clarifies child care issues. Court questions Quade. State - no objection to reduction of bond - $1000 cash. With restrictions of no contact with Mike or Mary Kegley or their property. Roley asks for $250 cash. Robert Conn (grandfather) makes comment. Court - reduces bond to $500 cash. No contact with Mike or Mary Kegley or any property belonging to them.
from defendant asking for bond reduction - sent up to JA
and certificate of appearance - Captain JM
and certificate of apperance - Deputy AC
CD was served on behalf of AG
and Dertificate of Appearance - WLA, Analyst
request for allowing another attorney to proceed-sent to JA this date for possible schedulong as JT scheduled in 1/15
Added - No contact with Mary Kegley
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Mary Kegley.
Jury trial on January 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Called at 3:15 PM. Megan Quade appears via video from FOSO and her attorney Tom Roley appears in person. State appears by Jodie Bednar Clemens. Roley has Information, waives reading of it. Roley - no argument on bond. Court - make sure the no contact provision gets back on the bond. Court continues bond - re-add deleted no contact provision, sets for FPT on 12/3/14 on 3:15 PM. Quade now asks for speedy trial demand. Court now cancels the FPT, sets for JT on 1/12/15 at 8:30 AM.

Defendant Megan Marie Quade in court, in custody and appears with Attorney Tom Roley. Charles Simono appears for the State of Wisconsin. FTR Recorded. Here for preliminary hearing. Captin Marvin sworn in 1:15 PM. State directs. Record reflects defendant has been identified 1:21 PM. State offers exhibits. Court recieves exhibit #1 & #2 (pictures of bank video). 1:25 PM. Roley cross-examines 1:26 PM. Captin Marvin excused. Mary Kegley sworn in 1:31 PM. State directs. Roley cross-examines 1:36 PM. Mrs. Kegley excused 1:38 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State needs ARGN date. Continue bond.  Arraignment scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
in support of subpoena duces tecum

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 16, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called 9:13 am. Megan Quade appears via video from FOSO. Counsel Tom Roley appears in person on her behalf. State appears by Charles Simono. Defendant does not have complaint however copy given to her attorney for her. State will need to amend complaint to include party to a crime. Roley has complaint. Waive reading. Asks for PH date. Waive time limits. Court advises of charges/penalties and the complaint may be amended. Defendant understands. Bond continued. State comfortable proceeding next week. Adj.
